com.ca.mas.foundation

Class MASUser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ca.mas.foundation.MASUser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MASTransformable, ScimIdentifiable, MASUserIdentity, ScimUser, MASMessenger
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    User

    public abstract class MASUser
extends java.lang.Object
implements MASMessenger, MASUserIdentity, ScimUser

    The MASUser interface is a core interface used to represent a user in the system, as well as an Identity Management definition used in the interaction with SCIM.

    The MASUser interface contains the common attribute user which is the container for all of the other SCIM values, whether single or multi-valued. SCIM provides a resource type for "User" resources. The core schema for "User" is identified using the following schema URI: "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User". See the Full User Representation for the complete format.

      • logout

        public abstract void logout(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)

        Logs off an already authenticated user via an asynchronous request.

        This will invoke Callback.onSuccess(MASCallback, Object) upon a successful result.

        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback that receives the results. On a successful completion, the user will be logout from the Application.

      • requestUserInfo

        public abstract void requestUserInfo(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Requesting userInfo for the MASUser object
        Parameters:
        callback - The Callback that receives the results. On a successful completion, the user available via getCurrentUser() will be updated with the new information.

      • lockSession

        public abstract void lockSession(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Locks the current device. This will remove the access and refresh tokens, as well as the user profile. The ID token will then be moved to the fingerprint protected shared KeyStore.

      • unlockSession

        public abstract void unlockSession(MASSessionUnlockCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Triggers the Android unlock and captures the unlock result. Unlocks the ID_TOKEN from the KeyStore and places it back into the keychain, removes the locked ID_TOKEN, and then indicates if the device is unlocked.

      • isSessionLocked

        public abstract boolean isSessionLocked()
        Checks to see if the device has a locked ID token.
        Returns:
        true if there's a secured ID token

      • removeSessionLock

        public abstract void removeSessionLock(MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Removes the secured ID token.
